duties_responsibilities.duty: Takes ownership of reporting costs, productivity, margins, and expenditures.
Analyzes complex financial reports and records to assess accuracy, completeness, and conformance to standards.
Preparation and review of month-end journal entries for various entities.
Prepare monthly financial statements, reports, and records by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing account information.
Responsible for general ledger reconciliations and P&L analysis.
Makes recommendations based on analysis and status of reserves, assets, and expenditures.
Develops systems for the maintenance of financial records, making use of current technologies.
Reviews all billings and reconciliations monthly.
Managing and reviewing labor charges and cost allocations.
Work closely with external auditors (Financial and Workers Comp Audits).
Keeping up to date with current GAAP and other regulations and making recommendations on company accounting policies.
Contributes to department and organization special projects as assigned.
Backup other department personnel as needed, during planned and unplanned absences.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting (CPA or other professional certification preferred but not required)
